name: market for waste paper sorting facility | waste paper sorting facility | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/5583/documentation

This is a market activity. In the case of services or immobile infrastructures, markets are connecting suppliers and consumers at a global level. For specific connections at regional level, direct links between the local producing activities and the local consumers are preferred. Transport or losses are logically not relevant for this type of products.;This is the market for  'waste paper sorting facility', in the Global geography.;This market contains no transport or losses, as they are irrelevant for the delivered product.;This is an immobile infrastructure, representing the construction of waste paper sorting facility. The facility has a annual production of 33,000 tons sorted paper and a lifetime assumed to be 50 years. The process includes  land-use, buildings (hall and multi-story), the internal parkings and streets, the machineries for box waste paper sorting as well as the dismanteling/decommission of the whole infrastructure.

This activity starts with the built infrastructure ready to use.

This activity ends with the infrastructure made accessible to the users. Transport or losses are considered irrelevant for this product.
category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/429:Construction of other civil engineering projects/4290:Construction of other civil engineering projects
tags: Sector: Infrastructure & Machinery; Waste Treatment & Recycling; Pulp & Paper
